etymologies: mid 19th century. From Italian microsomia from micro- + ancient Greek σῶμα body + -ia

definitions: Abnormally small size of the body (dwarfism); (in full "microsomia fetalis") abnormally small size of the fetus for gestational age. Compare macrosomia rare. Perhaps Obsolete.
With distinguishing word: underdevelopment of part of the face, as a congenital malformation.
